channel.title: Blogdown on DataScience
channel.description: Recent content in Blogdown on DataScience

item.title: Data Visualization
item.description: Scattered plot Data visualization is a general term that describes any effort to help people understand the significance of data by placing it in a visual context. Patterns, trends and correlations that might go undetected in text-based data can be exposed and recognized easier. Here we will explore following libraries dplyr , Lahman , ggplot2 and ggiraph Lets fetch data from Lahman database about all the players whose Home runs are more than 400 and store it in a data frame df.

item.title: Data Visualization -2
item.description: Bar graph and Histogram In this post we’ll learn to draw Bar-graph and Histogram using the following libraries. > dplyr , > Lahman , > ggplot2 and > ggiraph Here we will all the teams who played in the year 1980’s. data1<-Teams%>% filter(yearID==1980)%>% select(teamID,HR) and plot a bar-graph ! ggplot()+ geom_bar(data = data1 , aes(x=teamID,y=HR),stat = "identity",color="red",fill="blue") Here it is ! But it looks very cluttered . Lets see if we can change the axis and make it more readable.
